subject: Parenting
title: The Discovery of Child Abuse
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Discovery of Child Abuse.

hook.text: In 1962, doctors published 'The Battered-Child Syndrome.' Before that, child abuse had no medical name.

buildup.text: For millennia, physical punishment of children was not just accepted â€” it was encouraged.

discovery.text: Henry Kempe's paper forced doctors to recognize that many 'accidental' injuries were inflicted by parents.

twist.text: Within ten years, every US state passed mandatory reporting laws. A silent epidemic was finally acknowledged.

climax.text: The paper didn't invent child abuse â€” it made it visible. Naming a problem is the first step to solving it.

punchline.text: Child abuse existed for millennia. Recognition of it did not.

quiz.question: What did Henry Kempe's 1962 paper 'The Battered-Child Syndrome' accomplish?
options: It made child abuse medically and legally recognized
It was widely ignored by the medical community
